definition: to break the rule/to make an exception
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: He deserves to be promoted to the rank of engineer, as an exception. Nobody should object to that.
sentences.chinese: 破格批准他为工程师，应该，这是谁也不应反对的。

sentences.english: Please understand that this is an exceptional treatment.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个破格的待遇，请理解这点。

sentences.english: A college or university teacher who ranks above an associate professor.
sentences.chinese: 他那所学院破格提拔他当副教授。

sentences.english: His college gave him accelerated promotion to Associate Professor.
sentences.chinese: 他那所学校破格提拔他当副教授。

sentences.english: A stanza of this sort is in many respects anomalous in Shelley's poetics.
sentences.chinese: 这种的诗节在雪莱的诗中很多方面是破格的。

sentences.english: I'd have to make an exception and admit you .
sentences.chinese: 那我只能让你们破格录取了。

sentences.english: During the year, and was promoted to the doctor's in abnormality.
sentences.chinese: 一年之中，又被破格晋升为太中大夫。

sentences.english: In 1959, selected to be the tutor of Tsinghua University;
sentences.chinese: 1959年因成绩优异被破格选拔为清华大学教师。

definition: to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
select the best people for promotion
to promote to a higher position
to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
to wait to fill a vacancy/reserve (candidate)/alternate/substitute
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to put in an important position
